alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 11:59PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following counties, Barbour, Randolph and Upshur. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1158 PM EST, County 911 dispatchers reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Buckhannon, Philippi, Audra State Park, Tallmansville, Ellamore, Overhill, Alton, Alexander, Helvetia, Volga and Eden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
